thread.title: ‘Night in Vienna’: GBS Mozart concert features violinist Debbie Wong
thread.title_full: ‘Night in Vienna’: GBS Mozart concert features violinist Debbie Wong

title: ‘Night in Vienna’: GBS Mozart concert features violinist Debbie Wong
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 
Greater Bridgeport Symphony Concertmaster Debbie Wong will lead the orchestra during a “Night in Vienna” Mozart concert on Saturday, Oct. 17, in Bridgeport. Photo: Contributed Photo Greater Bridgeport Symphony Concertmaster Debbie Wong will lead the... ‘Night in Vienna’: GBS Mozart concert features violinist Debbie Wong 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
It is rare when a conductor is missing from the podium at a symphony concert — unless the concert happens to be very intimate and the orchestra is a bit smaller than usual. 
The Greater Bridgeport Symphony has slated a very special evening on Saturday, Oct. 17, when it presents “An Evening in Old Vienna: Mozart” at the Klein Memorial Auditorium in Bridgeport. 
Mozart wrote his works for “chamber” orchestras — ones that would entertain in the manor houses and palaces of the time. Leading the orchestras would be the first violinist, known as the concertmaster. At Saturday’s concert, that honor falls to Deborah Wong , who has served in that position with the GBS since 2002. 
“I am so excited that Maestro (Eric) Jacobsen has invited me to share this evening of Mozart” with the Bridgeport audience, Wong wrote in an email. “In addition to performing my favorite Mozart Violin Concerto, No. 4 in D major, we will perform two lesser known early symphonies that are true gems and the glorious Symphony No. 29 in A major ... also one of my favorites. It is my great honor to lead the great Greater Bridgeport Symphony in this concert.” 
Also featured will be Symphony No. 10 in G major k.74 and Symphony No. 13 in F major k. 112. 
A student of the renowned Dorothy Delay , Wong graduated from the Juilliard School with both bachelor’s and master’s degrees. In demand as a guest concertmaster, she has performed in that position with the Oklahoma Symphony, the Brooklyn Philharmonic, the American Composers Orchestra, the Westchester Philharmonic and the Northeastern Pennsylvania Philharmonic. 
The Klein Memorial Auditorium, 910 Fairfield Ave., Bridgeport. Saturday, Oct. 17, 8 p.m. $59, $49, $39, $29. New: discounted tickets for students 18 and younger, accompanied by an adult, $10. Free parking. www.gbs.org
